title: Ash Training Day 5 Part 3
description: Understanding session timing, London and New York sessions, and time-based trading models.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• How session timing affects liquidity
• London session characteristics
• New York session overlap significance
• Kill zones and optimal trading times
• Session bias alignment
• Time-based trading models

quiz.question: Session timing affects:
quiz.explanation: Different trading sessions have different liquidity levels, directly affecting spread and execution.

quiz.question: London session is known for:
quiz.explanation: The London session overlaps with Asia and sees increased volatility and volatility expansion.

quiz.question: NY session overlap creates:
quiz.explanation: The overlap between London and New York sessions creates the highest liquidity and volatility.

quiz.question: Session bias must align with:
quiz.explanation: Session-based bias should confirm the higher timeframe bias for stronger setups.

quiz.question: Time-based models depend on:
quiz.explanation: Time-based models use kill zones (optimal trading windows) identified by session times and institutional activity.
